headline: KKR buys South Korea's Samhwa in $528 million deal
summary: U.S.-based KKR has acquired South Korea's cosmetics packaging company Samhwa Co from TPG in a deal valued at 733 billion Korean won ($528 million), Samhwa said on Thursday. KKR said the acquisition is an addition to its long track record of investing in Korean businesses. The firm had earlier backed companies, including fashion retailer Musinsa, energy provider SK E&S and recycling firm Ecorbit.

headline: E.l.f. Beauty Is Defying the Rest of the Cosmetics Business. Buy the Stock.
summary: Beauty is taking market share aggressively through social-media marketing.  The impact of tariffs is mitigated by price hikes—without losing demand.  Beauty is in the eye of the beholder—and investors don’t like what they see from beauty stocks.
